title: Mission Description
content: Aglaea shows sincere gratitude for our help in defeatingNikador, preparing generous gifts and inviting (Trailblazer) and I to theHero's Bathfor a discussion.

text: Now, in your private bath chamber
Ever since the battle with Nikador , you haven't slept so soundly in ages.
Even if Death itself came to rouse you, you'd proudly retort: Why does life slumber? Because the bed is warm...
Yet, a chill from the River of Souls wafted by, a sensation hauntingly familiar. Could Death truly be at your door?
Best to open your eyes, just in case...

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer), you're awake.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Is the room too cold?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...That's a complicated question. I'm not sure I can answer that.

speaker: Castorice
line: I apologize for arriving uninvited. I saw that you were still asleep, so I took the liberty of waiting nearby.

speaker: Castorice
line: I bring a message from Lady Aglaea. She has prepared a gift for you and Dan Heng , and wishes to present it to you in person.

text: What are we waiting for? Let's go!

speaker: Castorice
line: I'm glad you're in good spirits. Alright, let's set off.

text: Follow Castorice to meet with Aglaea

speaker: Castorice
line: The baths are bustling. Now that Nikador has fallen, the soldiers in the city can finally catch a break.

speaker: Castorice
line: Is that... Lady Tribbie and Lady Trianne?

speaker: Trianne
line: You must have forgotten! This is a precious relic from our hometown! We definitely all saw it back then!

speaker: Tribbie
line: Trianne, this is a counterfeit. We both know it's impossible for something this fragile to have survived all those years in one piece...

speaker: Trianne
line: Nothing is impossible! We are fragile, too! But we still got through those... those sad times. Look at that color... and how it glitters in the light... It's exactly as we remember it!

speaker: Trianne
line: Why won't you buy it? If someone else gets to it before us, we'll ... we'll miss our chance forever...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Calm down, Trianne... You need rest.

speaker: Merchant
line: Please, there's no need to fret. If you need more time to make a decision, I can put this aside for you until tomorrow... or until you're ready.

speaker: Tribbie
line: No, no, it's alright. Trianne is just... She'll come to her senses tomorrow. We'll be off first.

speaker: Trianne
line: Trianne is just what? Trianne is super mad, that's what!

speaker: Trianne
line: You've forgotten... You've forgotten all about Mama! Mama gave us something just like this before!

speaker: Tribbie
line: Trianne...

children.text: (Trianne runs off)

speaker: Merchant
line: Uh... See you tomorrow? I hope you two patch things up soon...

speaker: Tribbie
line: See you tomorrow. May the winds of fortune bless you.

text: Find out about what's happening from the merchants

speaker: Merchant
line: It's so hard to understand what they're thinking sometimes…

speaker: Castorice
line: Excuse me. If you don't mind, could you tell me what Lady Tribbie and Lady Trianne were discussing just now?

speaker: Merchant
line: Oh, it's Miss Castorice! It's been a while! Well, honestly, I'm not quite sure myself.

speaker: Merchant
line: See, I have a little hobby of collecting handicrafts. Some time ago, I found this trinket being sold at the Marmoreal Market and bought it to use as decoration at my stall.

speaker: Merchant
line: When Lady Tribbie and Lady Trianne walked by earlier, Lady Trianne happened to catch sight of it and promptly insisted that it was a precious memento from her hometown.

speaker: Merchant
line: But Lady Tribbie believed it to be a counterfeit. She said it couldn't possibly be from Janusopolis — the likelihood of such fragile glassware surviving the Chrysos War is simply too low.

speaker: Merchant
line: For some reason, Lady Trianne became awfully upset after hearing that.

speaker: Castorice
line: I see...

speaker: Castorice
line: Madam, would you mind selling this trinket to me?

speaker: Merchant
line: Certainly. It's just... if it truly is a relic from Janusopolis, it could be worth a small fortune... Miss Castorice, I'm running a business here, after all, so...

speaker: Castorice
line: I understand. Feel free to name your price.

text: Not so fast! I object to this!

children.speaker: Merchant
children.line: And what might your concerns be, my friend?

children.text: You've got some nerve trying to rip off a Chrysos Heir .
Tribbie already called it a fake! Are you trying to pull a fast one on us?

children.speaker: Merchant
children.line: I... Fine. I'll sell it to you at cost as a sign of goodwill, Miss Castorice. Just promise to support my business in the future!

children.speaker: Merchant
children.line: Uh... I suppose I can sell it to you at cost as a sign of goodwill, Miss Castorice. Just promise to support my business in the future!

speaker: Castorice
line: Much appreciated.

speaker: Castorice
line: Thanks for helping me out. I'm not one to venture out often, and while I have some savings, it takes a lot out of me to even talk to people, let alone haggle... Had you not been here, I would've been set back plenty.

speaker: Castorice
line: We're lucky that she has a good heart. I'm not one to venture out often, and while I have some savings, it takes a lot out of me to even talk to people, let alone haggle... Had it been another merchant, I would've been set back plenty.

speaker: Castorice
line: The authenticity of the piece isn't important. What matters is that it holds special meaning for Lady Trianne and reminds her of her hometown.

speaker: Castorice
line: I've long wished to show my gratitude for Lady Trianne's care, but I haven't been able to come up with any ideas for a suitable gift. This chance encounter today feels like divine intervention. Perhaps this is the gift I've been searching for.

speaker: Castorice
line: Still, this trinket is admittedly rather fragile. I will have to make some adjustments and stitch it onto wool felt to protect it. That way, no matter how much Lady Trianne runs around, it won't break easily.

text: Continue following Castorice to meet with Aglaea

speaker: Castorice
line: Alright, back to business after that little detour.

speaker: Castorice
line: Let's keep moving. Don't stray far now — we've already kept Lady Aglaea waiting long enough.

speaker: Castorice
line: It seems your friend arrived before us.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ You're finally here, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Aglaea
line: Welcome, Cas. And you as well, Trailblazer from beyond the sky.

text: You're up so early, Dan Heng!

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: You would've been, too, if you hadn't stayed up so late. But what matters is that you got a good rest.

text: I didn't expect you to call me that.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Your companion here kindly explained the meaning behind the name to me earlier.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Through him, I've come to understand that you and your friends walk the paths of Kephale and Janus in places beyond the sky. Addressing you appropriately is the least I can do as a show of respect.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...I'm sorry about my companion's behavior.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: ▶ Not at all. It's good to see (Trailblazer) bouncing back with such energy after that tough battle.

speaker: Aglaea
line: For all that has happened, it was never our intention to drag you two into the battle against Nikador and jeopardize your safety. To express our gratitude for your kind Trailblazing endeavors, we would like to present you with the highest honor of Okhema .

speaker: Aglaea
line: This is the Dew of Divine Blood , brewed from crops nourished by the blood of the Titans . It is said that only twelve bottles existed. The last three bottles are now being kept in the treasure vault of Okhema.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Back in the days of prosperity, cities fortunate enough to acquire it regarded it as one of the greatest treasures ever. Unsealing it during a ceremony held in honor of two cities' diplomatic ties was the highest form of respect one could show the other.

speaker: Aglaea
line: And now, in keeping with tradition, Okhema dedicates this drink to our esteemed guests from beyond the sky in appreciation of what you have done for us.

text: My hand is trembling under the weight of this gift...
I'm not of drinking age yet.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...The Express has house rules about drinking, and even I'm not exempt to them.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: This precious gift isn't simply a token of gratitude though, is it, Lady Aglaea?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Very perceptive, Mr. Dan Heng. Your heroic deeds have proven that you come in good faith. With the Dew of Divine Blood as testament, we wish to forge an alliance with the Trailblazers.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: With all due respect... won't forging an alliance with the Chrysos Heirs embroil us in the conflicts within Okhema?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I'm sure you can understand where our misgivings come from, Lady Aglaea.

text: Right, we need to think about this first.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Wow, you seriously took a liking to the gift.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Having said that, Lady Aglaea, please don't misunderstand, we will still do what we can to assist you in the Flame-Chase Journey.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It's just... I've heard of the friction between the Chrysos Heirs and the Council of Okhema . As outsiders, we are wary of getting caught up in this conflict—
Wow, Grayie and Dannie have sharp eyes indeed! You'd make outstanding members of the Twilight Courtyard !
No need to worry, by the way. I can tell from Lady Aglaea's tone of voice and micro-expressions that she's being genuine.
Not only are you guests from beyond the sky, but you've also done so much for Okhema. You're practically heroes to us all! Lady Aglaea would never subject you to Aquila 's judgment.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Hmm? You are...?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Hyacine. Thank you for taking care of the wounded over the past few days.

speaker: Hyacine
line: It's no trouble at all! The patients are very cooperative when we attend to them. I'm just thrilled to see them all going home healthy again.

speaker: Hyacine
line: And ooh! It's Cassie! I've missed you!

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Aren't they just the cutest nicknames? Hehe.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Um, Miss Hyacine, about that nickname... Could you—

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Aw, don't be shy. It's a cute nickname!

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Hehe...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Mis—!

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Wah! You can't say that! Lady Aglaea should always be "Lady Aglaea"!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: This girl... She's a natural at making friends.

text: She reminds me of an old friend with pink hair.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I'll let you take it from here, then.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Hehe, as an acolyte of Aquila , I'm here to bring healing light to the world. Plus, I've heard you're also children of the distant skies! Fate must have brought us together!

speaker: Hyacine
line: Can we be friends? I'd love to hear your tales of the sky! And ooh, it's a rare occasion that Okhema presents such an invaluable gift to guests. Lady Aglaea, may I have the honor of tasting it, too?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Of course you may. Esteemed guests of Okhema, please believe me when I say that this gift carries no hidden agendas. As for the matter of the alliance, you need not give me an answer here and now.

text: Ohh, she's here to help Aglaea recruit us.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Haha, you're mistaken! The capable Lady Aglaea doesn't need my help with things like this.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...I see. In that case, we will accept this gift from Okhema. We welcome the chance to talk with you, Lady Hyacine.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Yay! Then I'll get started on my questionnaire!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Pardon the question, but I've been meaning to ask this for a while: micro-expressions, tone of voice, questionnaires... Are these all part of the usual skill set for Aquila's priests?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Allow me to do the honors. This young lady is Hyacine, assistant lecturer of the Nousporists at the Grove of Epiphany and head nurse at the medical institution known as the Twilight Courtyard.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Many of the Chrysos Heirs suffered injuries during Nikador 's attack on Okhema, so the Grove sent Lady Hyacine to treat the wounded in Okhema.

speaker: Hyacine
line: But what I'm really good at is helping people sort out what ails their mind and spirit. If you're ever feeling troubled, come find me! A little sunbathing in the courtyard will chase all your worries away!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Ah, so you're a therapist. Thank you, we will keep that in mind.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Well, it looks like everything's sorted out now! The patients have also all recovered. I think it's time for me to head back, Lady Aglaea.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I would love to keep you in Okhema for a few more days, but I would hate to provoke the ire of the Grove.

speaker: Aglaea
line: As it happens, Okhema intends to send a messenger to the Grove for updates about the research on the black tide. We also want to communicate our desire to discuss the retrieval of Cerces' Coreflame at the earliest convenience.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That... sounds pretty serious. Lady Aglaea, you can't be asking me to...

speaker: Aglaea
line: No need to fret. We won't put you on the spot. Trianne will be going there as the diplomatic messenger of Okhema, and Castorice will be accompanying her.

speaker: Castorice
line: I happen to have a few questions for Professor Anaxa as well, regarding the missing Titan Thanatos .

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Since this involves Okhema's diplomatic affairs, we'll give you some privacy.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ If you're not keen on just sitting around, (Trailblazer), why not go with them? The Grove is a picturesque place, perfect for sightseeing.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That's a wonderful suggestion! Come visit the Grove, Grayie! I'd be delighted to show you around!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Sounds good. Gaining more insight into the customs and geography of different regions of Amphoreus is also part of Trailblazing.

speaker: Aglaea
line: In that case, do bring this spindle along with you.

speaker: Aglaea
line: This tool, called the Weft , is used to spin thread and has been passed down in my family through generations. Though it doesn't see much practical use nowadays, it's become a symbol of great significance. In this respect, it is the perfect token to represent my will. If you encounter trouble at the Grove, just take this out and show it to them.

speaker: Aglaea
line: While you're in the Grove, the golden thread of the Weft can also render all things around you visible, regardless of whether they're corporeal or not, allowing you to see things as I would. Castorice knows this, too.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Make good use of it. Trianne is already waiting for you at the outskirts of Okhema, so I won't keep you any longer. May your journey be smooth.

text: Speak with Castorice and Hyacine and prepare to head out

title: Step Description
content: During alliance negotiations with Aglaea, we encounter Hyacine from the Twilight Courtyard. (Trailblazer) and Castorice opt to join her journey back to the Grove to complete Aglaea's diplomatic mission.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Make good use of it. Trianne is already waiting for you at the outskirts of Okhema, so I won't keep you any longer. May your journey be smooth.

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ I'm glad to be in your company again, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer).

text: Tell me about the Titan known as Thanatos.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Thanatos ... controls my fate, in a sense. The curse I bear came from them.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: And they have something of mine... something of great importance that I must get back from them.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: When I was studying at the Grove alongside Phainon and the others, Professor Anaxa was responsible for teaching us about the Chrysos Heirs and the Titans. That's also when I met Miss Hyacine... She was Anaxa's teaching assistant then.

text: What is the Grove of Epiphany?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: The Grove of Epiphany is Okhema's partner academy. They look after the Coreflame of Cerces and are the organization at the forefront of researching phenomena such as the black tide and the Titans. They also provide academic research support for the Flame-Chase Journey.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Several Chrysos Heirs are based in the Grove, including Miss Hyacine and Professor Anaxa.

text: I don't have any more questions. Let's go!

speaker: Hyacine
line: I came here with a colleague from the Twilight Courtyard. I've asked her to pack her luggage in advance, so she's already waiting for us by the city gates. Let's go meet up with her!

speaker: Hyacine
line: Look, there she is... and Lady Trianne! But who's that they're looking at?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Did something happen, Clementine? Ah... that's a serious injury!

speaker: Clementine
line: Miss Hyacine, this man was—

speaker: Trianne
line: ...Was discovered by Trianne! Trianne was in a baaaad mood this morning, so we went to the outskirts of Okhema for some fresh air... b—but then we found him collapsed on the roadside!

speaker: Trianne
line: Trianne knows the city has good doctors! So Trianne brought our new friend into the city to look for a doctor!

speaker: Clementine
line: ...I was waiting here for Miss Hyacine when I bumped into Lady Trianne. By then, this man was already in critical condition... so I had to perform some emergency treatment first.

speaker: Hyacine
line: These wounds... They're caused by the black tide!

speaker: Hyacine
line: This is bad... Clementine, prepare a ward for this man at once. I'll treat him myself... It's a miracle he's still alive, considering how badly the black tide injured him.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Grayie, Cassie, and Trianne. Would you mind making your way to the Grove first? Once this man is out of danger, Clementine and I will join you.

speaker: Hyacine
line: As a healer, I cannot ignore those in need of medical attention.

speaker: Castorice
line: I understand. May fate have mercy on this poor man.

speaker: Trianne
line: Trianne believes he'll get better!

speaker: Hyacine
line: I'm sorry for leaving in the middle of the journey... but as a healer, I can't just stand by and watch someone pass away in front of me.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Please make your way to the Grove first. May Cerces safeguard your thoughts!

title: Step Description
content: With Hyacine remaining in Okhema to treat the unnamed wounded person, Trianne, Castorice, and (Trailblazer) head to the Grove — the academic sanctuary dedicated toCerces.

speaker: Trianne
line: Everybody, follow Trianne! Fly, fly, fly away from Okhema!

text: Speak with Trianne and prepare to depart

speaker: Trianne
line: Down this road we go! To the skies we fly! Leaving Okhema behind!

speaker: Trianne
line: Little Cas, Little Gray, are you ready?

text: Are we not using the Century Gate?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: You might not be aware of this... but using the Century Gate takes a significant toll on Lady Trianne.

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: Mm-hmm! Trianne promised Tribbie that we wouldn't open the gate unless we had no other choice!

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: I'm ready, too.

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: Okie-dokie! Everybody, let's hold hands! To the Grove we go!

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: The Grove is far! It's important to be ready!

text: Wait for Trianne to wake up

speaker: Castorice
line: Hm...

speaker: Castorice
line: It's harder than I thought to sew gemstones onto wool felt...

speaker: Mem
line: Cas has such nimble fingers. I want to learn too...

speaker: Castorice
line: Hehe, Mem wants to try sewing? Here, why don't you give it a go?

text: How are you two so close already?

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Cas and I are now good friends after traveling together for so many days!

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: It's hard not to like Mem when they're so adorable.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Sure.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: You go first! I'll cheer you on!

speaker: Castorice
line: This is amazing... It seems as if their voice has become more intelligible after the battle with Nikador ...

speaker: Castorice
line: After spending the last few days together, I feel like I'm gradually gaining the ability to understand what they're saying... even if it's just a little.

speaker: Mem
line: This shows that I'm learning new things! Once I obtain the memory of poking wool felt, will I grow hands that are as pretty as Cas' hands?

text: Scary. Don't teach her how to sew, Cas.

speaker: Mem
line: That's horrible! You can't say that to a girl!

speaker: Castorice
line: Hehe...

speaker: Mem
line: I was just kidding! Anyway, I believe that this trip to the Grove of Epiphany will definitely be a fruitful one.

speaker: Mem
line: How exciting... I wonder what changes I'll experience next?

text: You'll learn a powerful new ability!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Mm-hmm! Being adorable isn't enough. I need to be strong, too!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Do you like cute little animals that much? ...Are you secretly the type that cares a lot about outward appearances?

text: Transform into a cute girl! Now!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Wah, you don't have to yell!

speaker: Trianne
line: Phew... Is everybody awake? Little Gray, Little Cas, and... a little pink puppy?

speaker: Mem
line: Puppy? I've become a different species altogether...!? And here I thought she would just give me a nickname like Little Memmy...

speaker: Castorice
line: It's already Action Hour . Lady Trianne, I hope you're well-rested?

speaker: Castorice
line: You were talking in your sleep... Did you dream of many things?

speaker: Trianne
line: Sleep talking? Um... What did Trianne say?

speaker: Castorice
line: Something like... "Mommy! Doll with sword! Let's fight together! We'll be brave!"

speaker: Trianne
line: Eek, so embarrassing...! Please don't make fun of Trianne!

speaker: Castorice
line: Of course not.

speaker: Castorice
line: Wasn't Lady Trianne's mother also the Holy Maiden of Janusopolis?

speaker: Trianne
line: Uh-huh! Mama was the strongest Holy Maiden in all of our history! She also gave us the Prophecy of Deliverance... and she had red hair that looked like a cute red mushroom!

speaker: Trianne
line: But... Trianne can't remember what Mama looked like anymore... Not even in the dream just now...

speaker: Mem
line: ▶ In that case... (Trailblazer) and I will lend Trianne a hand!

text: But you don't have hands... Only paws.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: It's just a figure of speech!

speaker: Mem
line: Think about it: There are so many memories scattered all over this world! Surely at least one contains an image of Trianne's mama?

speaker: Mem
line: ▶ If I keep a lookout for it while searching for memories along our journey, then (Trailblazer) can go "boom"... and not only will Trianne be able to remember what her mama looks like, she'll even be able to talk with her! Right?

speaker: Trianne
line: Hmm... Trianne thinks that's a great idea! Can the pink puppy help Trianne out?

speaker: Mem
line: Only if you promise to stop calling me a pink puppy!

speaker: Trianne
line: Yay! Then I'll call you... Little Memmy from now on!

speaker: Mem
line: That's much better... Still, I'd like to know what exactly I am. That was just a name I came up with on a whim...

speaker: Mem
line: Ah, well... It doesn't matter, because I'll be sticking to my word anyway. Now that Trianne has cheered up, shall we get going?

speaker: Trianne
line: Okie-dokie! Trianne remembers that we need to help Agy ask the Big Tree whether Cerces would be willing to visit Okhema...

speaker: Trianne
line: If we follow this Woven Trail and keep going upward, we'll reach the Grove in no time.

text: Step onto the Woven Trail and enter the Grove of Epiphany

title: Step Description
content: With Hyacine remaining in Okhema to treat the unnamed wounded person, Trianne, Castorice, and (Trailblazer) head to the Grove — the academic sanctuary dedicated toCerces.

speaker: Mem
line: Woven Trail... Where did it get its name from?

speaker: Castorice
line: Legend has it that whenever they requested an audience with Cerces, Mnestia would always come to the meeting in a long white dress. As the warps and wefts of the dress came into contact with the ground, they turned into paths and stairs...

speaker: Castorice
line: May this romantic path bring good tidings to Okhema.

text: (Arrive at the top of the stairs)

speaker: Trianne
line: Look, a huge tree! It's... huge!

speaker: Mem
line: ▶ Wow, it's so majestic! (Trailblazer), hurry up and capture this moment!

text: Help March 7th take a picture of the giant tree as a keepsake

A giant tree bowed slightly in the silent forest, tilting and falling into the wilting green waves. A passing breeze rustled through the leaves, as if it was sighing, softly fading into the lightless ocean above on high.
Would March 7th appreciate this sublime scene? You're uncertain. Dan Heng, perhaps...
Never mind, every time he encounters a tree as big as this one, it would be a deeply troubling situation.
Take a photo of this big tree.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (I never fail to impress... This photo deserves an award!)

speaker: Mem
line: What is this huge tree, though...?

speaker: Castorice
line: It's the Bough of Rift — the divine body of Cerces. Flora began to grow where they planted their roots, and this flatland basin upon which we stand gradually became a large, verdant forest.

speaker: Castorice
line: A long time ago, Thalesus, the First Scholar, led the masses to build a garden and courtyard in the forest, naming the site the "Grove of Epiphany." There, people sought mental clarity, knowledge, and enlightenment.

speaker: Trianne
line: Trianne knows this! Everybody says that was how this big academy came to be.

speaker: Mem
line: But... is the academy supposed to be this quiet?

speaker: Castorice
line: Something feels off...

speaker: Castorice
line: The Grove has always welcomed scholars. So too would Cerces give us her delicate leaves and extend her branches in greeting.

speaker: Castorice
line: Yet... it seems both the Grove's messengers and the Titan are indifferent to our arrival.

text: So, we have no way in?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: There should still be a way in. I'm just... a little surprised.

text: Is the Grove closed to visitors?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: That doesn't seem likely... Miss Hyacine didn't mention anything about it.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Um... Please don't speak such words once we're in the confines of the Grove.

speaker: Trianne
line: Maybe everybody's still asleep because classes haven't started yet! They don't want to be disturbed, so they shut the entrance.

speaker: Mem
line: For now... let's look around and see if we can find out what's happened.

text: Find the way to enter the Grove of Epiphany

title: Step Description
content: The Grove, once filled with scholarly discourse, has now fallen into an eerie silence. (Trailblazer)'s group manages to enter, only to find that something seems amiss inside...

speaker: Castorice
line: This place is too quiet... What in the world is going on?

text: Pass the Janus' Hidden Passage and enter the Grove of Epiphany

speaker: Trianne
line: Trianne found it! Everybody, fly across to the other side!

speaker: Trianne
line: The entrance on the other side... Where could it be?

speaker: Trianne
line: Little Gray's eyes are so sharp!

speaker: Castorice
line: I knew you would find it. The Courtyard of Storge should be just ahead of us.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...As I expected, something's not right here.

speaker: Mem
line: Even though we're not scholars, someone should've come forward to receive us by now...

speaker: Castorice
line: Not to mention that this whole place is also eerily quiet.

text: Maybe Aglaea didn't give them a heads-up?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: There is no way she would have neglected such an important diplomatic matter.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Hm... That's possible.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: That's not very likely... As far as I can recall, the voices of people engaged in debate echoed throughout the Grove at all hours of the day.

speaker: Trianne
line: Helloooo? Is anyone thereeee?

speaker: Trianne
line: No one's here!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Come now... Don't give up so easily! At least struggle a bit like a scared bunny!

speaker: Castorice
line: ...I have an idea. Lady Trianne, could you lend me that golden spindle ?

speaker: Castorice
line: Do you remember? Lady Aglaea said this: "While you're in the Grove, the golden thread of the Weft can also render all things around you visible, regardless of whether they're corporeal or not."

speaker: Castorice
line: This is achievable because the Grove is not only where the roots of Cerces are... but also where the Chrysalis of Gold manifests.

speaker: Castorice
line: "O Mnestia ! With the Weft as my vow, I beseech you: Entwine my body with your golden thread and affection!"

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Ah, I'm sorry... I had to recite that chant so that the golden thread would resonate with the Titan's presence within the leylines.

text: Is this some kind of ritualistic prayer?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: This is... a proverb that was recorded in the handbook of Mnestia's priests.

text: Who came up with this? How... unique...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Well... These lines are documented in the handbook of Mnestia's priests, so...

speaker: Castorice
line: If I'm not mistaken... we should be able to draw power out of this butterfly exuvia with the golden thread.

speaker: Trianne
line: Ahh, there isn't a reaction... Did it not work?

speaker: Castorice
line: But that shouldn't be...

speaker: Mem
line: Eh? Everybody, look over there! Something's appearing...

speaker: Castorice
line: Is that... a White Dryad?

speaker: Mem
line: White Dryad... What a cute name.

speaker: Castorice
line: No, it isn't a White Dryad...

speaker: Castorice
line: It is the shadow of a dead White Dryad.

speaker: Mem
line: Dead White Dryad...

speaker: Trianne
line: ...Shadow?

speaker: Castorice
line: Strictly speaking... these white dryads are still plants. They only gained sentience as a result of Cerces ' blessing of equality, but their sentience is minimal when compared to that of humans. These flowers have already died... What you see here are just faint afterimages of their souls.

speaker: Castorice
line: However, this also means that the golden thread has definitely connected with the Titan's presence. Without the golden thread's outlines, we would not have been able to see them at all.

speaker: Trianne
line: But... what happened to them? Why are there only tiny shadows of them left?

speaker: Castorice
line: Mem, can you read their memories?

speaker: Mem
line: Let me try. Mem... memem...

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Almost...

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Hey! Don't say it together with me! You're distracting me!

speaker: Mem
line: "Black"... "Cloak"... and "Sword"...

speaker: Mem
line: "Toward the Great Tree"...

speaker: Mem
line: Uh... That's it. Their memories are too faint for me to see anything. I could only vaguely make out these words.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...I have a bad feeling about this.

speaker: Castorice
line: The deathly fog of Thanatos ... is fast approaching.

text: Leave the Courtyard of Storge and keep moving forward

speaker: Trianne
line: Oh... Trianne will be on high alert!

speaker: Castorice
line: The smell of Death... is becoming more and more intense.

speaker: Castorice
line: There... On the steps.

speaker: Trianne
line: This looks... really scary...

speaker: Mem
line: What kind of... beast is this? Or is it the Death Titan's Kin?

speaker: Castorice
line: No, it's neither of those...

speaker: Castorice
line: This is a creation of the black tide. Such creatures are formed when living beings are corrupted and turned into deformed, hollow husks of their former selves.

speaker: Castorice
line: Everybody, stay alert. Regardless of what has happened to the Grove, the fact that we're seeing the remains of a black tide creation here definitely doesn't bode well.

speaker: Trianne
line: Should we... should we inform Agy about this?

speaker: Mem
line: Ah, wait...!

speaker: Mem
line: That... black thing... seems to be moving?

speaker: Trianne
line: Th—The monster is alive! Trianne will protect everybody...!

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Trianne, please hide behind us.

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer), let's do this.

speaker: Castorice
line: As expected... the words "black," "sword," and "cloak"...

speaker: Castorice
line: ...They're talking about the black tide.

speaker: Trianne
line: Y—You defeated it! Little Gray, Little Cas, you're so strong...

speaker: Mem
line: But these monsters... They aren't supposed to show up here, right?

speaker: Castorice
line: To think the black tide has spread this quickly to the Grove despite its remote location...

speaker: Castorice
line: I'm afraid a world where Strife has fallen is far more dangerous than we ever imagined.

speaker: Trianne
line: Oh no... Does this mean that Okhema is also in danger?

speaker: Castorice
line: Looking at this mess... it seems the scholars at least succeeded in fending off the first wave of attacks.

speaker: Castorice
line: But... at what price?

text: At the same time, in Okhema

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lady Aglaea, after a few days of surgeries both major and minor, we were able to save the life of that patient found on the outskirts of Okhema.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Thank you again, Hyacine, for your hard work.

speaker: Hyacine
line: The scarring of his organs was especially severe, a result of the black tide's corruption... It's a miracle he's even survived. I can't say for sure when he'll regain consciousness...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Don't stress yourself out over this. You've already done everything in your power to save him. There's no need to hurry to the Grove either. You deserve a good rest now.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Tribbie, I have some things to tell you as well... There's something strange about where that patient came from.

speaker: Aglaea
line: He is not Okheman. The way the stitches on his clothes are hidden is quite unique... Such craftsmanship is undeniably from the Grove.

speaker: Tribbie
line: The Grove? You mean...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Now that I think about it, Castorice and the rest should have arrived at the Grove by now.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Ah! Trianne just got in contact!

speaker: Tribbie
line: Mmm...

speaker: Tribbie
line: The black tide has invaded the Grove...

speaker: Tribbie
line: We haven't detected any survivors, even with the help of the golden thread... Wh—What should we do, Agy?

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...The black tide is posing an even greater risk to us now. I did not expect the Grove to be the first to be impacted, though.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ Can they tell where the Coreflame is right now?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Mmm...

speaker: Tribbie
line: We see it... The Coreflame is still there, but...

speaker: Aglaea
line: But what?

speaker: Tribbie
line: ▶ But... they can't say for sure whether the Titan has also been corrupted by the black tide.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Ah...

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ Please let them know that for now, the most pressing task is to identify the Coreflame and transfer it to a safe place as quickly as possible. We must also search for survivors and find out exactly what happened to the Grove.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Oh, and... find Anaxa . Unless something went terribly wrong, he should still be alive.

speaker: Tribbie
line: They've set off. Please, stay safe, everyone...

speaker: Aglaea
line: I pray for their safety, too.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Agy... how do you know that Anaxa is still alive?

speaker: Aglaea
line: I know that man all too well. If that blasphemous "performer" knew that he was not long for this world, he would most certainly try to seize the Coreflame and drag the Titan down with him.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Is this... a joke as well?

speaker: Aglaea
line: No, I'm being serious this time.

speaker: Aglaea
line: We're facing threats from both within and without Okhema. The merciless carnage may have ceased, but Okhema's nemeses continue to sharpen their blades even now...

speaker: Aglaea
line: They may have even prepared the gallows from which to hang us already.

speaker: Tribbie
line: You mean...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Even if the divine authority of Strife is as yet unclaimed, the black tide is advancing more rapidly than expected... I fear this tragedy is more than a mere natural disaster.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Alas, it's too late. The Council will likely take this opportunity to do something... I will try to keep this under wraps for now, but you must also take care and be prepared for anything that may happen.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Alright. Should I... inform Hyacine about this?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Not for now... She must be exhausted after performing surgeries non-stop for so many days. I don't want to overwhelm her with this bad news.

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...We can only hope that the Grove weathers this crisis with as many survivors as possible.

speaker: Aglaea
line: That being said, based on the condition of this patient, Tribbie, we should prepare for the worst.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...It's likely he is the only one who managed to escape from the Grove, against all odds.

text: Keep going and investigate the cause of the calamity

title: Step Description
content: Black tide creations roaming throughout the Grove... this doesn't bode well. In this calamity, the Grove's fate looks grim. After reporting to Aglaea, (Trailblazer)'s group continues deeper into the Grove to investigate.

speaker: Trianne
line: Everything will be fine! The people at the Grove are really smart. They'll definitely be able to chase away the black tide!

speaker: Mem
line: Aglaea said that Anaxa is still alive. If that's true, then there's still hope for everyone else too...

speaker: Mem
line: Who is this Anaxa anyway? Why does everybody seem to have some kind of trust in him?

speaker: Castorice
line: How should I put it...

speaker: Castorice
line: Lady Aglaea doesn't "trust" Anaxa at all, I'm afraid.

text: He sounds like a big shot.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Hm? Were you in a similar situation before, friend?

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Believe me, she is far nicer to the two of you than she is to Anaxa.

speaker: Castorice
line: Despite being a Chrysos Heir, Anaxa resolutely believes that Titans and prophecies are a load of nonsense.

speaker: Castorice
line: During our regular citizens' assemblies, he always votes to oppose the Flame-Chase Journey.

speaker: Mem
line: Huh? And he's still able to conduct research here? Didn't you just say that the Grove is an academy that was established around a Titan?

speaker: Trianne
line: Trianne knows the answer to that! Everybody says that Cerces , who symbolizes reason, is the most tolerant of novel ideas. Apart from Kephale , they're the Titan who treats us the best.

speaker: Mem
line: Well, it looks like Cerces must really be open-minded if they're accepting of even this kind of novel idea .

speaker: Castorice
line: Yes, that is how we formed an agreement with these Titans who bear no harm toward humanity. If they agree to support us on our Flame-Chase Journey, we will wait till the final moments of the journey to restore their Coreflames.

speaker: Trianne
line: ...With the exception of Oronyx , that is. They didn't lend us their power willingly.

speaker: Mem
line: ▶ I don't think Oronyx was as reluctant to help us as you put it, or they wouldn't have deemed (Trailblazer) worthy and allowed me to journey alongside all of you!

speaker: Castorice
line: That is true. It's also fortunate that these gods weren't corrupted by the black tide and did not descend into madness...

speaker: Trianne
line: Trianne believes Cerces will be alright! After all, everybody says that the people of the Grove are really smart.

speaker: Trianne
line: So, Little Gray and Little Cas, just leave the task of finding Anaxa and everyone else to Trianne! It's easy for Trianne to look for people because we can fly!

speaker: Castorice
line: Good idea. In that case, please bring the Weft along with you, Lady Trianne. The golden thread will be much more effective from up above.

speaker: Castorice
line: Please promise us that you'll take care of yourself.

speaker: Trianne
line: Okie-dokie! If Trianne gets in trouble, we'll look for all of you. In return, if you get in trouble, remember to call for Trianne, okay? We'll come right over and open the Gate for you!

speaker: Castorice
line: That's the other thing I wish to mention: Do not open the Gate unless you have no other choice, Lady Trianne. Your body is... not in good shape at the moment.

speaker: Trianne
line: Ah... Okay, we will keep that in mind. Trianne was just trying to help...

speaker: Castorice
line: Of course we know that. After all, Lady Trianne is a demigod, the most powerful among all of us here.

speaker: Castorice
line: Remember all those brave heroes in the tales you've heard? They would always save their strength until the very last moment. That way, they could ensure that nothing went wrong with their plans. Isn't that right?

speaker: Trianne
line: Mm-hmm! In that case, brave Trianne shall clear the way for all of you!

speaker: Mem
line: Little Trianne is so motivated... I mustn't fall behind!

speaker: Mem
line: I'll use something to help all of my friends that only I have: Oronyx 's power!

text: Open the gate and continue forward

speaker: Mem
line: I wonder if I'll find any memories.

speaker: Castorice
line: So many monsters...

speaker: Mem
line: Maybe I'll find some useful memories here... Let me try.

text: (Investigate the monster on the ground, optional)
The monster's body is twisted like brambles, not allowing any living being to approach.

speaker: Mem
line: Let me see...

speaker: Mem
line: Ow, that hurt! And I didn't even detect any memories...

text: (Investigate the monster on the stairs, optional)
The black-colored monster has fallen like a toppled statue. Within its body lie golden ashes, perhaps the same substance as the golden blood that is commonly seen in Amphoreus.

speaker: Mem
line: Mem... Memem...

speaker: Mem
line: It's no good... I didn't see anything.

text: (Investigate the monster on the balcony, optional)
A despicable, twisted life form — it was once a living soul that could mourn pain, but now it can only turn its head at others, until its soul drifts silently out of its shell.

speaker: Mem
line: Maybe this monster will show us some useful memories...

speaker: Mem
line: I shouldn't have gotten my hopes up.

text: (Once all three monsters have been investigated)

speaker: Mem
line: Ugh, I really tried my hardest... Why couldn't I see even a sliver of a memory?

speaker: Castorice
line: It could be because when a life is devoured by the black tide... it loses its soul.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Hm, it's locked...)

speaker: Castorice
line: I can't open it... It was probably sealed in order to ward off the black tide.

text: There's no keyhole in this door...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Yes, most of the doors on Amphoreus are sealed using the power of Janus .

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Save your energy. Janus 's power... is far stronger than we could ever imagine.

speaker: Mem
line: Since this door is a creation of the Three Titans of Fate, maybe the eyes of Oronyx will help me find a way to open it...
Are you serious? Just a mere door, and your first instinct is to call on the gods?

speaker: Mem
line: Memi...!?
Before you try unlocking the door, perhaps you should first find a way to clear the fog that clouds your vision.

speaker: Mem
line: You scared me! Are you... the echoes of a memory?

speaker: Anaxa
line: My name is Anaxagoras, one of the Seven Sages of the Grove of Epiphany and the founder of the Nousporists. Before we go any further: Rule number one, do not call me Anaxa.

speaker: Mem
line: Anaxago... Anax... Ugh, I'll just stick to Anaxa. Now, can you tell me—

speaker: Anaxa
line: Rule number two: Never interrupt me. Silence is golden.

speaker: Mem
line: What a difficult person!

speaker: Anaxa
line: The person standing here and conversing with you right now isn't the vestiges of a memory. Rather, it is the culmination of the greatness of science and the pure, irrefutable, and undeniable exalted truth.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Through the wonders of alchemy, I have shattered my soul and transmuted it into gold before burying it in this spot. I have recorded these words so that visitors may learn where their next destination lies.

speaker: Mem
line: Alchemy can do that?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Nothing is impossible. Having said that, alchemy is not omnipotent. Each time you hear from me, an equivalent part of my soul is being consumed as the price. In other words — this voice isn't created out of thin air.

speaker: Mem
line: But how is it that you can respond to me...? Are you really the echoes of a memory?

speaker: Anaxa
line: That's because my precise calculations account for every possibility. I also know that you have already discovered the cause of the calamity at the Grove — the black tide — and that you mistakenly believe that the scholars have been wiped.

speaker: Anaxa
line: But that is where you're wrong: While the black tide was still approaching the Grove, the sages found a way to evacuate the vast majority of the scholars. They are heading toward the holy city of Okhema as we speak.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Only a small fraction of the scholars stayed behind with me to defend the Grove. If all goes well, Cerces ' Coreflame will reach Okhema before long...

speaker: Anaxa
line: ...But since you have accessed this message, something unforeseen must have occurred. For now, you should continue onward to the Luminary Throne where you may retrieve the Coreflame... and our mortal remains.

speaker: Anaxa
line: "And now, the objective is complete. That is all."

speaker: Mem
line: H—He disappeared again? Did he finish what he wanted to say?

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer), judging from your reaction, you must have found a useful memory.

text: (Recount what you saw in the memory)

speaker: Castorice
line: Professor Anaxa? That's a lot to digest at once... I'm sorry, please give me some time.

text: He said his name is Anaxagoras.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...You don't have to take that too seriously. For some reason, he's especially particular about his full name.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Professor Anaxa theorizes that all beings originate from the same source and have a similar composition, which in this case refers to the soul. He calls this theory Nousporism...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: It is an extremely complicated theory. You should get him to explain it himself if you're interested.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Provided that... he is still alive.

text: Everyone seems to have been evacuated.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Yes, that seems like the only good news so far. We can just focus on retrieving the Coreflame then.

text: Perhaps Anaxa... did not manage to survive.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: I... do not wish to consider this possibility.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Perhaps they were just unable to transfer the Coreflame, but managed to escape...

text: We have to go to the Luminary Throne.

speaker: Mem
line: The Luminary Throne ? What sort of place is that? Why would there be a throne in an academy?

speaker: Castorice
line: It is located at the top of the giant tree and is where Cerces' Coreflame is kept. According to Anaxa, the Coreflame should still be there.

speaker: Castorice
line: But making our way there... won't be as simple as the professor made it sound.

speaker: Mem
line: Oh... But on the bright side, it sounds like a place that's easy to defend and difficult to attack.

speaker: Mem
line: If that's really the case, I think that everyone including Anaxa will definitely be all right!

speaker: Castorice
line: Right... Let's see whether he left any similar directions for us along the way.

text: Keep moving forward and head to the Luminary Throne

speaker: Mem
line: Hey, the door can finally be opened! It seems like that message also served as a lock.

speaker: Castorice
line: Alchemy is truly... incredible.

text: (Once the marked location is within view)

line: "Happiness abounded in this lush land by gods chosen..."

speaker: Mem
line: Wh—What's that sound?

speaker: Mem
line: Huh...?

speaker: Mem
line: There's no one here... Did I just imagine that singing?

speaker: Castorice
line: No, you didn't imagine it. I heard it as well.

speaker: Castorice
line: I'm afraid that someone's probably nearby. As we are unable to ascertain whether they are friend or foe... we better remain cautious.
"Giants raised their glasses in a toast beheld by the twelve constellations..."

speaker: Mem
line: It's that voice again! This time, it's coming from...

speaker: Mem
line: ...I have no clue where it's coming from. There's too much echo in this library!

text: That's why you're supposed to keep quiet in a library.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: I know! Also, I wasn't even the one singing...

text: Don't be afraid, I have experience in ghost hunting!

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Why do you even have experience in that...?

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Found it.

speaker: Castorice
line: The voice is coming from... over there.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: How can a heart possibly speak — and it's not even lit up! I think that something supernatural must be at play here...

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: How can the air possibly speak! I think that something supernatural must be at play here...

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: White Dryads... Shadows of dead white dryads just like before?

speaker: Castorice
line: No, it seems to be coming from somewhere even further that way...

text: Find the source of the sound

title: Step Description
content: The Chrysos Heir Anaxa's whereabouts remain uncertain, but he left alchemical clues. (Trailblazer)'s group follows these leads to verify the Coreflame's condition.

speaker: Castorice
line: Let's go check it out.

speaker: Mem
line: S—Slow down. We don't want to alert them.

text: A statue resembling an old man draped in robes, seated in deep meditation...
...resembling an old man, draped in robes, seated in deep meditation, and capable of singing.

line: Ha... Regardless of what you do, a stone won't be able to speak.

speaker: Mem
line: Whoa... Who's there!?
Hehe... Such a lively little bunny. You even smell a little familiar.

children.line: What a smooth-talking child... I'll accept your praise.
What an impatient child... Don't you know that haste makes waste?

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Who are you? Keep your distance and identify yourself. Otherwise, you'll face the consequences.
The scent of Thanatos ... I recognize you. Aidonia 's renowned Goddess of Death.

speaker: Castorice
line: Since you are aware, stop provoking the authority of Death. Answer my question.
Hehe, baring your fangs at me... How cute.

speaker: Calypso
line: Just call me Calypso . I greet you on behalf of the Seven Sages and the Lotophagists .

text: I understand what you're saying, but... are you a specter?

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: Of course not. Just ask the fair lady beside you. She'll definitely know the reason why.

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ Be careful, (Trailblazer)... Even if the head of the Lotophagists has never shown their true identity before, we shouldn't trust this person so easily.

speaker: Castorice
line: The Weft could not detect her presence just now. That would be out of the ordinary if she were truly a phantom body. But if she is someone who has passed on, I should be able to tell...

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Let me test her.

speaker: Calypso
line: Do you mind if I join your private conversation?

speaker: Castorice
line: That would be rather inappropriate for someone who isn't even willing to reveal their real self. Forget it.

speaker: Castorice
line: However, I'm going to ask you some questions. Please answer them truthfully. If you can do so without hesitation, we won't treat you as an enemy for the time being.

speaker: Calypso
line: A pop quiz? Well, that sparks my interest. Go ahead.

speaker: Castorice
line: What was the topic for the grand finals of the 752nd Great Debate?

speaker: Calypso
line: "Is a flying arrow in motion or at rest?"

speaker: Castorice
line: Who was your representative?

speaker: Calypso
line: Medea. She went up against Phainon of the Nousporists.

speaker: Castorice
line: Who won?

speaker: Calypso
line: Nobody won because the 752nd Great Debate never took place.

speaker: Calypso
line: What I just mentioned happened during the previous debate. Phainon emerged victorious and obtained his tenth consecutive debate wreath. Also, to alleviate your worries, I shall provide you with a piece of information that's more valuable than the great debate...

speaker: Calypso
line: Anaxa the Nousporist is still alive. I saved him, and he is now recuperating at the Luminary Throne... So, are you satisfied with my answers?

speaker: Calypso
line: Hehe, this dumbfounded expression of yours... is much more adorable and likeable than the previous one.

speaker: Calypso
line: As the saying goes, "Seeing is believing." Why don't you follow me to the throne and take a look for yourself.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...I'll keep my eyes on you at all times.

speaker: Calypso
line: Oh, that's truly an honor.

speaker: Mem
line: Hm... With that... the discussion is over?

speaker: Calypso
line: As long as we can get the water wheel turning, we'll be able to use it to ascend...

speaker: Calypso
line: ...So, the solution is to "awaken this 'heart'."

text: Follow Calypso's guidance and find a way to keep going forward

title: Step Description
content: During their advance, a mysterious woman identifying herself as Calypso appears suddenly, stating she saved Anaxa and offering guidance to (Trailblazer)'s group to the Luminary Throne.

text: A giant waterwheel. It looks like it can turn, and it can actually turn. If the waterwheel could turn right now, it would be a sure win. It's a pity that it can't be turned for the time being.
The answer is "water" — without it, the waterwheel cannot turn.

speaker: Calypso
line: Why did you suddenly freeze? Do you have another way to make the water wheel turn?

text: It's simple, I'll just have to turn it.

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: Indeed... You can only do so much by yourself.

children.text: (Exits dialogue)

speaker: Castorice
line: Can you... really do it?

text: The pure white girl gazed at you with a subtle expression, while the pink creature's large eyes held a hint of curiosity. And that ghostly woman appeared unwilling to open her eyes.
Once the bow is drawn, there's no turning back. You decide to proceed...
Come up with a relatively normal idea.

children.speaker: Normal
children.line: ? Gosh, what a pity.

children.text: With both hands, you press against the heavy stone slab, resembling a scraper but actually the bottom of a sedan, and with a sudden push—
The waterwheel didn't even move an inch...
I'll use all of my strength!

You move one foot back, brace yourself, and lower one shoulder while supporting the slab with the other. Once steady, you repeat your technique, placing both palms beneath the slab. With a sudden surge of strength, you channel all your power into your shoulder and hands—

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ Haaa—Haaaaaah!

children.text: Your heavy breathing is a testament to your determination, deeply moving, as even the forest leaves rustle in response.
Has the waterwheel moved? — No, because it needs water to turn. What a pity.

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: Indeed... You can only do so much by yourself.

children.text: Forget it. That doesn't seem like it's going to work.

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: Indeed... You can only do so much by yourself.

text: Come up with a trailblazing type of idea.

children.text: Courageous! Then, how "Trailblazing"?
Akivili , lend me your strength!

" Trailblaze ," it's "Trailblaze!" You remember whenever in trouble, keeping "Trailblaze" in mind has always guided you through adversity. You once even toppled an almost nascent Aeon with it. A mere waterwheel is trivial by comparison.

Indeed, it is "Trailblaze," and only "Trailblaze." You center your breath, nod slightly, and close your eyes, entering a state of deep meditation. Before you is not darkness, but a vast tapestry of countless galaxies unfurls like a scroll...
Amidst the vast expanse of stars, a voice, a voice from the past pierces your mind: " Nameless , do as you intend!" — Who could it be? It is (seemingly) Akivili, the eternal beacon of the Express!

"999,900 layers of Trailblaze power! Nameless, we unite!" You (seemingly) merged with the fallen Aeon as one, and then the Trailblaze power immediately surged! Rise! Leap! Such dominance and such ferocity...

As such a "Trailblazing" Trailblazer, what in the world could possibly stand in your way? Son of a fudge, nothing can stop you, let alone an immobile waterwheel! You snap your eyes open and let out a fierce roar— [ Note 1 ]

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ Haaa!

children.text: You unleash the (presumably) surging force of Trailblaze within you. So, has the waterwheel begun to turn?
— No, because it needs water to turn. What a pity.
Ultimate Extreme Galactic Phantom Heavy Caliber Home Run!

Exactly, this is how it should be done — no, how it can only be done! To destroy all obstacles... It's your art where " Destruction " and "Traiblaze" intertwine. This is the reason you are the Galactic Baseballer and the protagonist of Legend of the Trailblazer !
At this critical moment when the waterwheel refused to turn, (Trailblazer) shouted:

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ Ultimate Extreme Galactic Phantom Heavy Caliber Home Run!

children.text: Like a celestial thunderbolt piercing the earth, the "Destruction" radiance threatened to tear apart the Dawn Device , shattering the firmament. In an instant, within the many delves of Amphoreus, everyone felt the world overturn and the mountains and rivers tremble. It was as if the imperial bow had returned to shoot the stars, splintering sacred trees and raising clouds of dust...
Oops, wrong channel, this is Amphoreus, not the Legend of the Trailblazer . So, did the waterwheel move?
— No, because it needs water to turn. What a pity.

text: Admit that you were only joking.

children.text: Once spoken, words are irrevocable. As the Kremnoans would often say, "the word 'joke' does not exist in the Trailblazer's dictionary."
To avoid a guilty conscience, think it over carefully. Don't let your partners down!
(Return to previous menu)

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...I'm not.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: She's laughing. But I managed to hold it in!

text: Although it failed... I'm sure I can put it to good use next time.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Truly a rare sight to behold.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: This is indeed an incredibly precious memory.

speaker: Castorice
line: This heart is the source of all water in the Grove...

speaker: Calypso
line: Indeed. When the sparks of inspiration burst forth within the Grove, dewdrops fall and land within the pool.

text: Then let me ignite my creativity... Ummmm...

children.text: You hold your breath and focus. Drip drip! A drop of water falls into the pool.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Huh... Can that really work?

children.text: ...No, it was merely an ordinary drop of dew, following the natural laws of water's three states, not born of inspiration.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: It seems like it won't be possible to fill it up with just the few of us...

text: Actually, I have some Solid Water .

children.text: (SubmitSolid Water)
You placed a piece of solid water, and it quickly dissolved without a trace.
A futile effort. Yet your fervent hope to revive this great tree was so intense that some presence from the distant multiverse cast an approving gaze upon you.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: It seems like it won't be possible to fill it up with just the few of us...

speaker: Calypso
line: Heh... Just come with me.

speaker: Calypso
line: We must first retrieve a treasure if we want to awaken the heart.

speaker: Castorice
line: Is that the... "Chamber of Purifying Tears"?

speaker: Calypso
line: You have a good memory.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Why exactly did you bring us here?

speaker: Calypso
line: My intentions should be obvious...

speaker: Calypso
line: See that shallow pond over there? Water lilies grow there. Initially, Cerces watered them with their tears while Mnestia nurtured them with affectionate love. They are a token of the eternal companionship between the two gods.

speaker: Calypso
line: All the two of you have to do is to cross the deep well and retrieve the Golden Bough of Vows for me.

speaker: Mem
line: ...Cal, you're making things sound too complicated. All you want us to do is to retrieve the flower, right?

text: Is this how you're going to test a Nameless?

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: Indeed. Could it be that you actually do not know how to proceed?

text: Could the deep well be a trap...?

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: Heh, you're making it sound so ominous.

speaker: Castorice
line: We can retrieve it, but I advise you not to waste your time on any schemes.

speaker: Calypso
line: Oh my, I'm helping you to eliminate your worries and obstacles, and yet I receive nothing in return?

speaker: Calypso
line: Besides, the bough is essential for awakening the heart and drawing water out of the source. If you can't find it this time, we can just remain trapped here for the rest of eternity.

speaker: Mem
line: What's that supposed to mean!? Are you planning to keep us here forever?

speaker: Calypso
line: Heh, you're overthinking things. We're all in the same boat.

speaker: Calypso
line: Although, it would be absurd to say that I have no other motives. Since you've brought it up, I might as well take this chance to explain...

speaker: Calypso
line: I'm simply making use of this opportunity to see what you two are made of. So, is that truthful enough for you?

speaker: Mem
line: See what we're made of... Could you have phrased that any more directly?

speaker: Calypso
line: Now is not the time for me to elaborate further. So, please proceed?

speaker: Calypso
line: As a student of Anaxa, "equivalent exchange" should be something that you are familiar with.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...I cannot deny that.

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), since our interests are aligned right now, it's better for us to do as she says. Besides, she knows about my past... Even though I'm not able to elaborate much, I can tell you that she has reasons to fear me.

speaker: Castorice
line: If you unfortunately turn out to be her ultimate target... Please don't worry. I will promptly intervene.

speaker: Mem
line: It's so reassuring to have Cas around. I should put my brain to use too, then.

speaker: Mem
line: Hm? The time dimension revealed by the orb shows... water lilies growing there.

text: Pass the deep wall and obtain Golden Bough of Vows

speaker: Mem
line: This flower looks so soft and fluffy... Heh, watch this!

text: Tutorial/Ichor Vessels and Cognos Bloom Sprouts

speaker: Castorice
line: Huh? There are ichor vessels stored here...

speaker: Mem
line: Wow... So, this is how flowers are grown!

speaker: Calypso
line: Hehe... How smart.

speaker: Castorice
line: Let's hope that this is not a trap set by her...

speaker: Castorice
line: So, this is the Golden Bough of Vows...

speaker: Castorice
line: ...I hope that the Titan will not take their anger out on us.

text: So, what we're doing is simply provoking the Titans...
Don't worry. There are several Aeons that have my back.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...If only THEY could interfere in the affairs of the Titans.

speaker: Calypso
line: Heh, so lustrous and beautiful... It's even more magnificent than before.

speaker: Mem
line: Hey, Cal!? Don't suddenly appear out of nowhere and scare me like that! My tiny little heart cannot take it... This is already the second time!

speaker: Calypso
line: Understood. My apologies, pink bunny.

speaker: Mem
line: It's pink bunny this time? I'm truly an all-encompassing species...

speaker: Castorice
line: Is... this the legendary Golden Bough of Vows?

speaker: Calypso
line: Hehe, we'll know once we test it.

text: Offer the Golden Bough of Vows to the heart

speaker: Calypso
line: There's a secret passageway behind the pond. It's faster if we take that path.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...How do you know this place so well?

speaker: Calypso
line: Well... I'm one of the Seven Sages after all.

speaker: Calypso
line: We're here. Could you kindly pluck a petal for me and place it into the pool?

text: (Remove a petal from the Golden Bough of Vows.)

speaker: Calypso
line: Now, can our little goddess perform that again?

speaker: Castorice
line: Huh?

speaker: Calypso
line: That being the oath of Mnestia 's priests.

speaker: Castorice
line: Right, got it...

speaker: Castorice
line: "O Mnestia ! With the Weft as my vow, I beseech you: Entwine my body with your golden thread and affection!"

speaker: Mem
line: Oh... It really lit up!

text: What is the principle behind this?

speaker: Calypso
line: Heh, it's just... an ancient promise between the Titan and humans.

speaker: Calypso
line: So, what do you think? It really is the Golden Bough of Vows, and I did not set any traps for you, right?

speaker: Castorice
line: That is... indeed true.

speaker: Calypso
line: Haha, you look like a sad lost puppy. Even if this is indeed a scheme to get you to lower your guard, you don't have any other choice but to play along, do you?

speaker: Calypso
line: Therefore, why don't we just put everything aside and work together? We can always determine who's right and who's wrong once we overcome this.

speaker: Castorice
line: Yes... I agree.

speaker: Calypso
line: Great. Then, let's ride the water wheel...

speaker: Castorice
line: However, giving us half-truths is not the right attitude for cooperation.

speaker: Castorice
line: Furthermore, according to the principle of "equivalent exchange," since we have passed your so-called trial, isn't it time for you to make your intentions clear to us?

speaker: Calypso
line: Ahh, I really can't bear to look at your sad expressions. Although you only cleared a simple trial... I'm willing to make an exception and treat you with sincerity.

speaker: Calypso
line: I'll allow each of you to ask a question... Ah, but not the little bunny. So, ask away.

speaker: Mem
line: What's with this unfair treatment? Is it because I'm too smart and you're afraid that the question I ask will turn Amphoreus upside down?

speaker: Castorice
line: ▶ Well... In that case, ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer), please go ahead.

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: Hm...

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: As I've previously mentioned, I'm one of the Seven Sages of the Grove of Epiphany. If you think that this answer is insufficient, then I'll add to it. I'm the leader of the Seven Sages.

text: Why don't you show your true appearance?

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: Mmm... A good question.

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: It's an inability to do so rather than an unwillingness. For me to appear in my true form, I'll require your help.

text: What is your purpose in testing us?

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: Mmm... A good question.

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: I want to ascertain your ability to help me reclaim my true form... and reclaim the Grove from the black tide.

text: Why do you say that our fates are intertwined?

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: Oh... Straight to the point.

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: The Titans have cast a net over this place because of the black tide. If we want to escape, I'll require your help to reclaim my true form.

children.speaker: Calypso
children.line: That's no good... You asked two questions.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ...Let's not get into a game of semantics, Lady Calypso.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: ▶ ( Mr. / Miss ) (Trailblazer), I will observe her reaction based on your question to determine whether she is being truthful.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: So, don't worry about it. Go ahead and ask your question.

children.text: (Go back to the previous options)

speaker: Calypso
line: Well, it's your turn now, little goddess of Death.

speaker: Castorice
line: My question is: Was your previous answer the whole truth and nothing but the truth?

speaker: Calypso
line: There's no point in making this unnecessarily complicated.

speaker: Castorice
line: That applies to you as well. However, we do not harbor any hostility. We merely want to avoid any potential harm to us.

speaker: Castorice
line: Lady Calypso, if you want us to work together more effectively, I advise you to answer my question honestly.

speaker: Calypso
line: Hehe... Alright. I was completely truthful in my response just now. I have not deceived you, nor will I.

speaker: Castorice
line: With all due respect, omitting facts can also be considered deceit.

speaker: Calypso
line: Is that so? Regardless, I still stand by my previous response.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Then, please lead the way. After all, facts speak for themselves. The truth will come to light once we arrive at the Luminary Throne.

speaker: Calypso
line: Alright, alright. I originally thought that you were just a beautiful flower planted in the mortal realm by the Hand of Shadow ... But now, I see you have some prickly thorns too.

speaker: Castorice
line: I'll just consider that a compliment.

speaker: Calypso
line: Indeed, I'm complimenting your charming naiveté.

text: Take the waterwheel to head to the top level of the Library of Philia

speaker: Calypso
line: Alright, go ride the water wheel. I'll wait for you up there.

speaker: Mem
line: Eh... So, you don't actually have to take the water wheel?

text: Leave the Library of Philia and head to the Luminary Throne

speaker: Calypso
line: Speaking of which, don't you also have a red-haired companion ?

speaker: Mem
line: Seriously... Exactly how much do you know about us?

speaker: Calypso
line: Hehe, not too much. It's just that I seem to hear the sound of a bee buzzing around.

speaker: Castorice
line: Lady, your metaphors... are not worthy of praise at all.

speaker: Mem
line: Phew, finally! Some fresh air!

speaker: Mem
line: Brr... But the wind feels so chilly...

speaker: Trianne
line: Woah, it's Little Gray, Little Cas, and the pink puppy!

speaker: Mem
line: I... Forget it. I'll just be a puppy. Be forgiving... Be forgiving!

speaker: Castorice
line: Lady Trianne! Are you alright? Were you hurt?

speaker: Trianne
line: No, Trianne flew high up into the air so the monsters couldn't reach us .

text: All that matters is you're alright.

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: Heh heh, also, the spindle that Agy gave us is so powerful that Trianne seems to have found Nax ...

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: Yup! The spindle that Agy gave us is so powerful that Trianne seems to have found Nax...

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: "Air supremacy secured!" ...That sounds so cool! But what does it mean?

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: Wait a minute, let's get back on track! The spindle that Agy gave us is so powerful that Trianne seems to have found Nax...

speaker: Trianne
line: He's near the treetop! Even though our perception of him is very weak, it's not like the White Dryads from before.

speaker: Trianne
line: But, since Trianne was alone and afraid that it might be dangerous, we did not fly there to take a look.

speaker: Castorice
line: It seems like Lady Trianne did not forget our promise.

speaker: Castorice
line: Anaxa is indeed still alive, and he's at the Luminary Throne right now... It seems like Lady Calypso did not lie regarding this.

speaker: Trianne
line: Hm? Kalipso... Who's that?

text: She seems to be the head of the Lotophagists.

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: Oh, so you found a survivor! But the golden thread doesn't seem to be able to sense the person you're talking about.

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: Oh, so you received help from a kind-hearted person! But the golden thread doesn't seem to be able to sense the person you're talking about.

text: A spirit... wandering around the Grove?

children.speaker: Trianne
children.line: Whoa! A spirit... Trianne wants to meet this spirit that even the gold thread can't sense!

speaker: Mem
line: Cal, come and meet our other companion!

speaker: Mem
line: Hm? Where did she go off to...

speaker: Castorice
line: Coming and going without a trace... She's such a strange person.

speaker: Trianne
line: Oh, actually, Trianne also found this. Could this be related to the person you're talking about?

speaker: Castorice
line: This is... a piece of burnt cloth?

speaker: Trianne
line: Yup! Trianne found it on a branch not long ago. Trianne even used the golden thread to search around and found that the entire Grove is giving off a similar aura.

speaker: Mem
line: Maybe... Anaxa left it behind using alchemy, in order to guide us?

speaker: Trianne
line: Trianne doesn't think so. Because when Trianne picked it up, we didn't see anything at all... And judging by the golden thread, the aura seems to be all around!

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Lady Trianne, where is the aura gathered at right now?

speaker: Trianne
line: Mmm...

speaker: Trianne
line: It seems to be... a little higher and a little ahead of us.

speaker: Castorice
line: The Dome of Devotion...

text: Keep moving forward and pass through the Dome of Devotion

speaker: Castorice
line: Calypso... Just what are you hiding?

speaker: Trianne
line: Ugh, the golden thread is vibrating more and more violently...

speaker: Castorice
line: Everyone, let's be even more cautious.

text: (Once the marked location is within view)

speaker: Castorice
line: There's no one... Hold on, the Butterfly of Divine Mind is gone?

speaker: Castorice
line: That can't be. Was it for fending off the black tide, or perhaps...

speaker: Trianne
line: What exactly is this "Butterfly of the Vine Mine"? Is it a very powerful guardian monster?

speaker: Castorice
line: No, how should I put it... It's considered a safeguard for the Titan's Coreflame. This butterfly is created from Mnestia 's remaining divine mind and bears the responsibility of guarding the Coreflame.

speaker: Castorice
line: Legend has it that someone can only pass the trial of the butterfly by proving they possess pure and unselfish love within their heart. Only then can they awaken the Great Tree to open up the path to meet Cerces .

speaker: Trianne
line: But how are we... going to prove it?

speaker: Mem
line: Will telling the Titan "I love you" work? Mem is good at doing that!

speaker: Castorice
line: Sorry, but even I don't know how... After all, this is a secret among secrets that only a select few in the entire Grove and even Amphoreus know.

speaker: Castorice
line: Rather than worry about this, Lady Trianne, did the golden thread react to anything around here?

speaker: Trianne
line: Umm, no. That unknown thing seems to be even farther ahead and higher up.

speaker: Mem
line: Uhhh, but... Isn't that a dead end up ahead?

speaker: Castorice
line: Perhaps we can try again... Let's see if the butterfly will still react to the Golden Bough of Vows despite having dissipated.

speaker: Castorice
line: If it's indeed the token mentioned in the legends, there should be a reaction.

text: Take petal from Golden Bough of Vows
You take a single petal from the Golden Bough of Vows and offer it with both hands.
The butterfly didn't even move one inch.
Just hang on a little longer, a sincere heart will prevail.

children.text: Even in the native myths of Amphoreus, it all boils down to "sincerity brings miracles." Show genuine intent, and the butterfly will surely respond...
...Yet, regrettably, it remains unmoved.

text: Pick up the petal and wave it in front of the butterfly.

children.text: With your extensive experience in dealing with little creatures, you are certain the butterfly will not ignore you—unless it can resist the urge.
...Alas, it seems it has indeed resisted the urge.

text: Chew on the petal with a highly provocative expression.

children.text: Understanding the common nature of human society, you believe that the drive to compete is an innate instinct of all living beings — surely the butterfly is no exception — and that vying for shared prey should awaken this primal urge deeply embedded in its genes.
...Alas, it seems to have declined your challenge for a duel.

text: I did what I could, but the butterfly didn't even move an inch.
Do we also have to use some kind of special spell?

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Let me give it a try.

speaker: Castorice
line: "O Mnestia ! With the Weft as my vow, I beseech you: Entwine my body with your golden thread and affection!"

text: The butterfly still didn't move one inch.

speaker: Trianne
line: Waaaah!

speaker: Castorice
line: Lady Trianne? ...And even Mem? Where have they disappeared to?

speaker: Trianne
line: Little Gray, Little Cas... Look over here... Quick!

speaker: Trianne
line: Memmy... is about to burst into flames!

text: Find Mem and Trianne by listening to the sounds

speaker: Castorice
line: The voice seems to be coming from the Star-Chase Atrium.

speaker: Trianne
line: Waaaah... Little Gray, Little Cas! It's bad... It's very bad!

speaker: Mem
line: Don't worry, friend... I'm fine...! I just feel... a little warm...!

speaker: Mem
line: But... It would be best if you could keep me from becoming a snack for these little things...!

speaker: Mem
line: Sorry, I shouldn't have called you guys "little things"...!

text: Calm down, we'll be right there!
If that's the case, let's get out of here.

speaker: Castorice
